intro: Adenoncos sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran adenoncos, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in lowland and hill forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
